intro: Goethalsia meiantha, commonly known as the slender goethalsia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and showy, pale yellow or white flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Goethalsia meiantha is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
